definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Down the Yangzi River from Chongqing?
sentences.chinese: 是從重慶上船順長江而下？

sentences.english: Loudly in cases of life of the people on board the boating shore, let the police check.
sentences.chinese: 繼宗高聲命船上的人把船泊岸，讓警察上船檢查。

sentences.english: We embark at Montreal for New York.
sentences.chinese: 我們在蒙特利爾上船去紐約。

sentences.english: Terror-stricken, the pirates ordered everybody to go on board.
sentences.chinese: 惶恐之中，海盜命令大家上船。

sentences.english: Right down the mountain and onto the ship.
The moment the son was about to go aboard the ship, they kissed good-bye with tears.
sentences.chinese: 在兒子即將上船的時刻，他們含淚吻別。

sentences.english: They scrambled over side and threatened to pull away.
sentences.chinese: 他們爬上船威脅說要划走。

sentences.english: After Jesus had sent the crowd away, he got into the boat and went to the vicinity of Magadan.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌叫衆人散去，就上船，來到馬加丹的境界。

sentences.english: People are waving farewell to passengers on board.
sentences.chinese: 人們紛紛向已上船的人揮手告別。

sentences.english: He invited the woodcutter aboard the boat. He happily played the guqin for him.
sentences.chinese: 他立即請樵夫上船，興致勃勃地爲他演奏。

sentences.english: And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.
sentences.chinese: 39耶穌叫衆人散去，就上船，來到馬加丹的境界。

sentences.english: The stevedores are already on board. Let's go and have a look.
sentences.chinese: 裝卸工已經上船了，讓我們去看看。

sentences.english: We embarked at Shanghai for Qingdao.
sentences.chinese: 我們在上海上船去青島。

sentences.english: We disentangled the ropes and heaved them on the ship.
sentences.chinese: 我們解開纜繩上的結，把纜繩絞上船。

sentences.english: Before the ship back on high Jinbang swear with Lin Yuhui walk.
sentences.chinese: 高金榜上船之前發誓日後回來帶林語慧走。

sentences.english: Keep your regulator in your mouth until you are on the boat orthe beach.
sentences.chinese: 保持呼吸器在你口中，除非你上船或上岸。

definition: (of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
to embark/to travel by ship/to ferry
the bow or prow of a ship
